name: Add new Clusters to kube-manifests|Spinnaker Self Serve.txt - How to add a new kubernetes cluster to kube-manifests?
description: This section explains the steps to add a new Kubernetes cluster to the kube-manifests repository, which is used for managing Kubernetes resources through GitHub Actions and Spinnaker. It involves creating RBAC roles and service accounts, storing the cluster's authentication token as a GitHub secret, updating the GitHub Actions workflow and Kubeconfig files to include the new cluster, and modifying the entrypoint script to configure the Kubeconfig with the new cluster's token.
use_cases: Adding a new Kubernetes cluster to the kube-manifests repository
Enabling GitHub Actions and Spinnaker to manage resources on the new cluster
Automating the deployment and management of Kubernetes resources across multiple clusters
capabilities: RBAC role and service account creation
Conditional execution based on cluster environment

name: Add new Clusters to kube-manifests|Spinnaker Self Serve.txt - How to add a new kubernetes cluster to Spinnaker?
description: This section explains the process of adding a new Kubernetes cluster to Spinnaker, a continuous delivery platform for deploying applications to Kubernetes clusters. It involves deploying RBAC on the new cluster, adding tokens to a credential store, updating Kubernetes configuration files, applying changes using Terraform, and redeploying Spinnaker with the new cluster configuration.
use_cases: Adding a new Kubernetes cluster to Spinnaker for deploying applications
Integrating a new Kubernetes cluster with Spinnaker for continuous delivery
Scaling Spinnaker deployment across multiple Kubernetes clusters
Enabling Spinnaker to manage and deploy applications to a new Kubernetes cluster
capabilities: Deploying RBAC on a new Kubernetes cluster
Storing and managing credentials in a credential store
Updating Kubernetes configuration files for Spinnaker
Applying changes to Spinnaker configuration using Terraform
Redeploying Spinnaker with the new cluster configuration
Integrating a new Kubernetes cluster with Spinnaker
